abstracts.cdata!:
The Fertilizer and Food Policy Credit
            Project seeks to reform fertilizer subsector policies and
            the structure of fertilizer use by removing subsidies and
            other distortions, identifying and providing better and
            cheaper fertilizers, eliminating supply inadequacies, and
            thus implementing a sound policy framework for fertilizer
            usage. The policy reforms to be implemented under the
            project will make possible more widespread and efficient use
            of fertilizers and lay a sound basis for increasing cereal production.
